security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document is a payroll authorization form and related memorandum for Constance Smith, who accepted a position as Secretary with the John F. Kennedy Task Force, effective March 13, 1978, at a salary of $13,500.00.
summary_one_paragraph: The document contains several forms and memoranda related to Constance Smith's employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Specifically, it includes payroll authorization forms showing her appointment as a Secretary within the John F. Kennedy Task Force, effective March 13, 1978, at an annual salary of $13,500. A memorandum from I. Charles Mathews to Thomas Howarth confirms this appointment. Additionally, there is a certificate from Constance Smith stating she has no familial relationships with any current members of Congress.
title: Payroll Authorization Form
